name: Casting Age
description: The age where you will learn how to cast metals into better tools and learn other technologies that make it easier to survive.

quests.name: Out of the Stone Age
quests.description: Where you learn the secrets of basic metalurgy.

tasks.longDescription: It is time to progress into the Metal Ages. The most important metal early on is Copper. You will make your first tools from copper or a bronze alloy. You will find nuggets of metal on the ground, which indicates there is at least one ore block within 35 blocks of surface in a 16x16 area of the nugget. All tool casts require 100 units of metal to fill. So you will need 10 nuggets. You can skip right past copper tools and craft bronze alloy tools. This task accepts any copper nugget.

Clay can be used to make casts. Casts are used to make copper and bronze tools. You are also able to smith copper and bronze tools on an anvil. The advantage of smithing tools is that you will increase your smithing skills that add a bonus to all smithed tools. Once your reach the Iron age tools are exclusively smithed.

tasks.description: Smelting Ores in a Pit Kiln
tasks.longDescription: You now have enough nuggets to make at least one metal tool. Each nugget is worth 10 units and it takes 100 units to fill one ingot or tool mold. Place the nuggets into a ceramic vessel and fire it with the three molds. If you are making alloy be sure you have the correct ratios. If your math is wrong you will just get your nuggets back. When the kiln is done take out the saw mold and ceramic vessel with liquid copper. Right-click to open the vessel and place the mold inside. Once the mold is full, remove it and then place it in your crafting grid to remove it from the mold. The mold is destroyed and you will get a saw blade. Craft a complete saw using the blade over a stick. The saw is very useful at this point because it allows you to cut logs into lumber, which is used to craft a number of wooden items. Your first craft should be turning 4 lumber into a plank and then 4 planks into a crafting table. This will expand your personal crafting grid. This task accepts any saw.

quests.name: The Art of Mining
quests.description: Where we learn about rock layers, finding ore deposits, and mining without being crushed by falling blocks.

tasks.longDescription: The TFC world has 3 layers of rock which generate independent of each other. There are 21 different rocks types that are divided into 4 categories. Sedimentary (only top layer), Metamorphic (top or middle layer), Igneous Intrusive (top, middle or bottom layer) and Igneous Extrusive (all layers). Ores and minerals are found throughout the world in veins and clusters, but where they spawn is dependent on the rock type. Remember all those nuggets you found, well hopefully you marked their location as that is where you need to go look for the ore veins. If you right-click with the prospectors pick it will search around that point (25x25x25 area) for traces of ore and minerals and tell you how much was found. It will give false negatives as well. Use the prospector's pick to locate the vein. This is a task you will want to master and it is best to read the TFC wiki or watch TFC dev KittyChanley's tutorial on the Prospector's Pick. This task accepts toos made of any metal.

As you may have noticed by now, many things are effected by gravity. When you mine raw stone there is a chance that you will cause a cave in. To prevent cave ins, place two supports that are at least 3 blocks high with at least one horizontal beam connecting them. This will prevent cave-ins 1 block above and below and 4 blocks out horizontally from the horizontal beam(s). The vertical beams offer no support. Even if the raw stone you are mining is supported it can still cause unsupported blocks in the area to cave in and this can spread back into the supported area. Please visit the TFC wiki for more detailed explanation.

quests.name: The Wonders of Wood
quests.description: Where we learn how to use the saw to make things out of logs.

tasks.longDescription: Now that you have a saw, you can finally craft chests. These chests are a little different than vanilla. They are smaller and not all items will fit into them. They are crafted with 8 lumber pieces of the same type. This task accepts chests made of any wood.

quests.name: Bronze
quests.description: Where you learn to make useful copper alloys.

tasks.longDescription: A mixture of copper and other metals make a stronger alloy. The percentage of each metal in an alloy is the number of units, so be sure you know how many units each ore contains. There are 3 kinds of bronze alloy available. The differences between the 3 are minor so any will do. Check NEI for the ratios. All bronze can be made in pit kiln or in a crucible. This task accepts any bronze alloy ingot.

quests.name: Basic Smithing
quests.description: Where we learn to make an anvil.

tasks.longDescription: Unlike tools you cannot skip the copper anvil, but don't worry eventually you will have the technology to reclaim all the metal in your anvil. It is best to be prepared so before making your ingots you had best make your first anvil. The tier 1 anvil is made from a raw igneous stone. Right-click on the top of the block with a hammer to form the anvil. The bottom left slot if for your hammer and the bottom right slot is for your flux. To make your copper anvil you will need enough copper for 14 ingots. Fire vessels full of copper in a kiln along with clay ingot molds. You fill the ingot molds the same way as tool molds. Unlike tool molds the unshaped ingots will have a temperature. You will need to wait until the ingots solidify to remove them from the mold. You will also get your molds back, but there is a chance they will break. Don't let those hot ingots cool too fast as you will need them hot to weld them. If your ingots cool too much they will reheat them in a forge. In TNFC you can craft ingots into metal nuggets with a chisel. The nuggets are small enough to be placed in a small vessel to remelt.

It is time to weld your hot copper ingots into double ingots. If you are fast the ingots will be hot enough still after pouring to weld. Look at the temperature tooltip to know if it is hot enough. If they cool too much read tip is the last step for help. To weld the ingots, you need your stone anvil which contains a hammer and flux. The stone anvil is only capable of welding copper ingots. Place the two ingots at welding temperature in the left slots and click weld button.

Now all you have to do is craft the anvil. Just remember before you do that its heavy, so if you want to carry it around it needs to go on your back. Metals and Alloys are organized into tiers. Anvils can weld metals/alloys one tier above their material and smith items the same tier as their material. So a copper anvil can weld copper and bronze only and is able to only smith copper tools. So now that you have a copper anvil you have the technology to make a bronze anvil.

quests.name: The Forge
quests.description: Where we learned to heat metal.

tasks.longDescription: The forge multi-block in its smallest form is just 5 solid non-flammable blocks and either 7 pieces of charcoal or 1 coal block. The solid blocks must surround the forge on all 4 sides plus the bottom. If you are using charcoal the 7 pieces of charcoal are placed with right-click. The charcoal/coal will make the forge when you light the charcoal with a firestarter or a flint and steel. Like firepits, the forge will be put out by rain; however, unlike firepits the forge requires a chimney, which is a clear view to sky within one block of forge. This task accepts brick blocks of any rock type.

Barrels are used for many things. They function much like large vessels with more slots. However some crafts can only be done in a barrel. Barrels are crafted with 7 pieces of one wood type arranged in a U. This task accepts any type of Barrel.

With the quern you can now turn grains into flour. Place the grain into the quern's left slot, exit GUI and right-click on the wooden handle to rotate the mill stone. This task accepts any type of flour.
Now that you have flour, combine it with a wooden bucket of fresh water to make dough. This task accepts any type of dough.

Now it is time to cook the bread. Place the dough into a firepit. When the bread is cooked it will drop to the output slot, but it will keep cooking here and eventually can burn up. This task accepts any type of bread.

quests.name: Wooden Bucket
quests.description: Where we learn to pick up water.

tasks.longDescription: The Wooden bucket is a simple solution to transfer cool liquids such as water, milk, and vinegar. Although you can place water down it will quickly vanish as it is unable to place source blocks.
You can use a bucket to fill a barrel with fresh water or to make dough from flour.

quests.name: Grinding with the Quern
quests.description: Where we learn how to grind things to dust.

tasks.longDescription: The Quern is a stone tool for hand-grinding a wide variety of materials. You will need the Quern Base and the Handstone which goes inside on the topmost slot. To craft the Quern Base, you will need to smooth stone with a chisel. To craft the Handstone, you will need to get stone blocks. To do so you must mine around a stone block until you remove all other connected blocks. When the last block is removed it will drop as a stone block. If you are still confused, explore the wiki or Youtube.

quests.name: Charcoal Pits
quests.description: Where we learn how to make Charcoal.

tasks.longDescription: The charcoal pit is constructed by completely covering log piles with a non-flamable solid block. For your first charcoal pit we suggest covering it with dirt. Log piles are formed by shift right-clicking the ground with a log. Log piles can be stacked, but only if the bottom pile is completely full. You will then need to cover the entire log pile with a non-flammable block, except for one open block. Ensure that there are no air spaces. To light the pit, drop a torch on the top of the log pile you left exposed. There will be a sparking animation and eventually the log pile will catch fire. Quickly cover the burning log pile with a non-flammable block. You will should see smoke particles coming from the active charcoal pit, but sometimes the smoke particles bug out. The pit will turn into charcoal over the next 18 in-game hours. Once there are no more smoke particles you can uncover the pit and dig our your charcoal with a shovel. Again the smoke particles can bug out. This is why we suggest covering your first charcoal pit with dirt as some of the dirt will collapse when the pit finishes.

quests.name: Tanning
quests.description: Where we learn to turn raw hides into leather.

tasks.longDescription: There are three sizes of raw hides. The size of the raw hide depends on the size of the animal. Find one of each.
Place your large hide in a barrel or large vessel of limewater and seal it. It will turn it into a soaked hide in a few hours.

Now that your hide is soaked you will need to place it on the top of a horizontal log by right-clicking. You then need to scrape the top of it with a knife by right-clicking. Once the hide is fully scraped you can remove it from the leather rack with a right-click. You now have a scraped hide. It is possible to hold right-click and drag your cursor over the hide to scrape quickly, but it is tricky.

The next step is to place the scraped hide in a barrel or large vessel of fresh water for a few hours. Place it in the barrel and seal. When it is done you will get a prepared hide. It is best to prepare a barrel or large vessel of Tannin while you wait for your hide. Place a log of Oak, Birch, Chestnut, Douglas Fir, Hickory, Maple, or Sequoia in a barrel or large vessel of fresh water and seal it.

The last step is to place the prepared hide in tannin for a few hours. When your tannin is done place the prepared hide in and seal it. When it is done you will get leather. You craft leather using a GUI similar to knapping. Right-click with a piece of leather in hand and a knife in your hotbar to open the crafting GUI.

quests.name: Flux Powder
quests.description: Where we learn how to make use of powdered rocks.

tasks.longDescription: Flux powder is used when welding in the anvil as well as to create limewater. Flux is crafted by crushing chalk, dolomite, limestone, marble, or borax with a hammer. Limewater is used in a lot of crafts. It is crafted with 2 flux per bucket of fresh water in either a large vessel or a barrel

Like salads you prepare sandwiches on the food prep surface. There is a tab at the top to toggle between sandwiches and salad crafting. Place the bread and other ingredients into the food prep slots and click create to make a sandwich. The numbers above the slots show how many oz of that food will be in the sandwich. Sandwiches have a minimum weight of 7 oz and maximum of 10 oz. Like salads you can not repeat ingredients. Sandwiches have the advantage of being able to contain all the food groups and be eaten in one bite. This task accepts any sandwich.

quests.name: Making Bricks
quests.description: Where we learn to make bricks.

tasks.longDescription: Bricks are made of chiseled stone and mortar. First you need to craft the bricks. Place rocks into your crafting grid with a chisel to craft. Mortar is crafted in a barrel. Place sand into a barrel of limewater and seal. Each sand and 100mb of limewater will make 16 mortar. Don't worry if the craft will make more than a stack of mortar, you can pull multiple stacks out of the barrel. In TNFC you can also make mortar from gypsum, use NEI to get this recipe. This task can be completed with any rock type.

Bricks are not effected by gravity, so they are useful for making multi-block structures and houses. Craft a brick block with 5 bricks and 4 mortar. This task will accept brick blocks made from any rock type.

quests.name: Armor Smithing
quests.description: Where we learned to smith armor.

tasks.longDescription: To start you will need to work a copper double ingot into a metal sheet.
Now that you have a copper sheet you can work it into a copper helmet. This is the first of three stages in making a helmet.
Now that you have an unfinished helmet, you need to weld it with the other copper sheet.
The last phase is to take your helmet back to the anvil and work it into the finished helmet.

quests.name: Advanced Weapons
quests.description: Where we learn to defend ourselves with a better offense.

tasks.longDescription: Now that you have an anvil, you can start working metal directly into weapons. Weapons smithed on an anvil have bonus durability and damage based on your smithing skill. To use the anvil you will first need to have your metal hot enough to work. Place your hot metal into the first of the two central slots and click the plan button, which is to the right, to bring up all the possible crafts. This will give you the rules you need to follow for your final 3 moves in the craft. The craft is complete when the 2 arrows align, perfectly. If you move the red arrow too far right you will lose your metal. We recommend watching the tutorial by dev KittyChanley to better understand smithing. To start you will need two double copper ingots and one single copper ingot.

The sword is a great weapon against those zombie hordes. To forge a sword, you need to start with a double ingot. Work the heated ingot on your anvil for a bit and you will have a fine sword. Swords do slashing damage. This task will accept any sword.
A mace is a weapon that does crushing damage. With a mace in hand you can now smash those pesky skeletons into piles of dust. This task will accept any mace.
The stone age Javelin is reborn. Metal javelins last longer and do more damage. This task will ONLY accept copper javelin.

quests.name: Hammer and Chisel
quests.description: Where we learn to chisel stone

tasks.longDescription: The chisel is a useful tool for smoothing stone and making bricks. To smooth stone you will need a chisel in hand and a hammer on your hot bar. Right-click the raw stone with the chisel and you can pick it up with a pickaxe. Smoothed stones are not effected by gravity. There are 4 chisel modes in TFC, you may have to rebind the mode button to switch between them. You can tell which mode you are in by the icon to the right of your hotbar. Smooth mode smooths raw stone. Stair mode will remove 1/8 of a block at a time. Slab mode will shave a 1/8 slice off the block. Detailed mode allows you to chip away tiny bits. The chisel isn't just for stone; you can chisel many other blocks as well. Be aware you can't chisel any raw stone that has 2 or more pieces of raw stone above it. TNFC has the TerrafirmaStuff addon, which adds additional chisel modes, whose icons are slightly blue. It adds a Smooth mode that only works on hardened clay blocks. Chiseled mode that works on hardened clay and Mineral Blocks (Jet, Serpentine and Quartz). Circle mode that works on stone and hardened clay blocks. And Pillar mode that works on stone, hardened clay and mineral blocks. This task accepts any chisel.

quests.name: Bronze Anvil
quests.description: Where we learn more about working with anvils.

tasks.longDescription: With a copper anvil, you can now weild together bronze ingots. You will need to do this first, since you need a bronze anvil to do anything else with bronze. For the anvil craft all double ingots must be the same type of bronze.

Now you can make a bronze anvil. With it you will be able to work bronze into a variety of items. You will now need to use the anvil to craft enough bronze double sheets for a bloomery, which will allow you to move into the Iron Age.
